intro: Tarenna polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited tarenna, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to Madagascar, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that are typically green when immature and turn yellow or red when mature. Tarenna polycarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
